sources.data_found: SuperPOD: 20 nodes, 8x NVIDIA A100 (80GB) per node. Faculty partner nodes: 1x A100 40GB node; 2 nodes with dual V100; 1 node with dual V100; 1 node with AMD MI210 64GB.
M3 gpu-dev partition: 3 nodes, 8x NVIDIA V100 GPUs per node.
ManeFrame II: 36 accelerator nodes, each with 1x NVIDIA P100 GPU.

student_data.notes: Source is SMU Registrar's Office report dated September 12, 2024: "Fall 2024/Fall 2023 Summary of Declared Academic Plans". In the Lyle School of Engineering > Computer Science section (Page 10 of 18), Fall 2024 declared majors are: Computer Science - BA (97) and Computer Science - BS (133), totaling 230 undergraduate CS majors (used for undergrad_cs_count). Graduate CS counts are: Computer Science - MS (227) (used for grad_cs_count) and Computer Science - PhD (43) (used for phd_cs_count). The row "Computer Science - MS - Online" is present but has a blank/zero value for Fall 2024. Additional context (not included in undergrad_cs_count): Computer Science - PMJ (pre-major) = 148; Computer Science minor (MN) = 42.

gpu_resources.notes:
Cluster-by-cluster GPU totals (nodes × GPUs_per_node):
- NVIDIA DGX SuperPOD (MP): 20 × 8 A100-80GB = 160 A100-80GB.
- M3 gpu-dev partition: 3 × 8 V100 = 24 V100.
- M3 faculty partner nodes (V100): fp-gpgpu-3 has 2 × 2 V100 = 4 V100; fp-gpgpu-4 has 1 × 2 V100 = 2 V100. V100 subtotal = 24+4+2 = 30.
- M3 faculty partner node (A100-40GB): amd001 has 1 × 1 A100-40GB = 1 A100-40GB.
- ManeFrame II (M2) accelerator nodes (documented): 36 × 1 P100 = 36 P100.
- M2 (Retired, 2019) inferred from SMU HPC 'About' table Total GPU Cores = 275,968. Assuming P100 (3,584 CUDA cores/GPU) => 275,968 / 3,584 = 77 GPUs. Assumed 77 × 1 P100 = 77 P100.

Grand totals (summed across the above): A100-80GB=160, A100-40GB=1, V100=30, P100=113. No SMU sources found indicating H100/H200/L40S/A6000 GPUs on these shared clusters.

analysis_notes: Data collected via multi-query approach: separate student and GPU searches.
